Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Lynette-Hartson
Reviews.Content: On arrival, we found the reception staff to be very helpful and we quicky felt at ease. The room was fairly roomy and very well maintained. Our biggest praise though must go to the Restaurant staff who were very friendly and insisted that we 'sample' cocktails or new dishes they had made. The head chef (wish I could remember his name) was outstanding and made us feel so at home, despite our intention to just dine in on the 1st night only, we actually went back another evening! the food was very well prepared and tasty. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “modern funky hotel”
Reviews.Author: podkez
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a package holiday. The hotel reception is perfect, very friendly and helpful staff. The bar is very well stocked and the bar man was very welcoming. The rooms are very modern and clean. Lots of space and storage. Our window wouldn't lock and one call to maintenance had it sorted. Nice flat screen tv with satellite but its all im Italian. . . Not sure what else i expected!! The breakfast was cereal, toast, yogurt, cheese, ham and boiled eggs. Tea and coffee. The staff during breakfast were also very friendly. We arrived late Saturday night so decided to eat in the restaurant for ease, my chicken was served raw. Not a tiny bit under cooked but straight up raw!!! It was sent back to the kitchen only to come back microwaved within an inch of its life. . . You know chicken is microwaved cus it goes ultra white and floppy. That was also taken away only to be replaced by a nice veal in red wine sauce. . . Too little too late though. When we got to Rome the main things we wanted from the break was some tasty Italian food so our first meal was such a let down. We didn't eat there again because i didn't want to spend the rest of our break on the can!!! Location wise the hotel is a 20 min walk to the tube line which means when you go out early morning to head to the city by the time its late evening we couldn't be bothered to go back to the hotel to freshen up and change before having dinner due to it taking nearly an hour to get back to the hotel. Only a small gripe though because it means you get more time out seeing the stunning city. Very nice hotel run by very friendly people but avoid the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room but some distance from the city centre”
Reviews.Author: danco28
Reviews.Content: This hotel has comfortable and smart rooms and breakfast is OK, but it is quite a distance from the city centre. On arriving the man checking us in was fairly gloomy and unwelcoming, but other staff were nicer. It's best to get a taxi from the airport to the hotel and probably easier to use taxis around town (Rome public transport is quite a challenge!). The area the hotel is in is a residential one and there aren't many bars or restaurants in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “It Snowed it Rome!!!”
Reviews.Author: TOB1950
Reviews.Content: My husband and I could not have guessed that we would be in Rome during it's first snow storm in 30 years. We had choosen the Executive Style Hotel and we are very happy we did. Even with the weather being so bad the owner and staff went out of their way to make us feel as welcome and warm as possible. The rooms are of the highest quality and very comfortable. The food was great with a nice selection. The staff at the buffet breakfast often surprised the guests with little treats like hot crepes. I can only guess how great this hotel will be with out snowmen on the front lawn. You will not be disappointed at the ESH. Enjoy!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “ESH - Lovely hotel, 25mins from Rome Central by Metro”
Reviews.Author: JoClarke86
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely. My boyfriend and I booked 3 nights at the ESH and really enjoyed it, we had an excellent deal through Broadway travel £149 pp inc flights. I cant fault one aspect of the holiday. The bedroom was a good size, the bathroom was very big and very clean. The staff were helpful and when we reported that our TV wasnt working someone attended within minutes to bring us a remote. It was about 25 minutes from leaving the Hotel to geting at the Spanish Steps, it is a 10 minute walk to the station and then 10/15 minutes on the tube. You can get a metro pass for 3 day for 11 euros, great deal if you ask me, we got our use out of it. Rome itself was beautiful and the the hotel was a great base for us. Breakfast was good, there was a fine variety and both of us left with ful tummy's every morning. Strongly recomend.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Room”
Reviews.Author: Misa391
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our 3 night stay in an executive room. The room was very spacious with a large comfortable bed and a luxurious bathroom with a lovely big, powerful shower. The breakfast was fine and catered for all tastes.We ate dinner twice in the restaurant and the food and service were both very good. We hired a car from the airport and parked in the hotel grounds. On trips into Rome,we drove to Batitstini metro station and parked the car in one of the no charge parking spaces nearby. On our last day, we drove to Marino and Frascati in the Roman hills which made a nice quiet contrast. We would definitively return.

Reviews.Title: “Rome trip”
Reviews.Author: Ellennb
Reviews.Content: Great stay at this hotel. A bit outside the tourist area but once you get the hang of the transport system it was great fun. Lovely hotel, great breakfast, much better than expected. Rooms are Very nice and the best shower I have had better than some 5* . New barman who is lovely and working hard to create a nice atmosphere after a busy day sightseeing. Great asset to hotel. Would highly recommend and defiantly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bigladrob
Reviews.Content: Travelled with Broadway Travel to the ESH Hotel, it was very reasonably priced if a little out of the way. The Rome bus service is very hit and miss so travelled on the Metro most of the time. The ESH is very modern and very well presented, the rooms are spacious however no tea/coffee facilities in the room and no English channels on the TV not even world news. The breakfast is continental style and plentiful with a good coffee machine with loads of choices. We were B&B, and we did find a really good supermarket up the street for nibbles in the room. We only had one drink in the bar due to the top prices charged so beware.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Natwala
Reviews.Content: This hotel was cheap so we weren't expecting much. We were pleasantly surprised when we checked in. The hotel is modern and clean. The room was a bit small, but again clean and modern with a nice bathroom. It is a little out of way for all the tourist attractions in Rome, but if you walk 10-15 minutes (or catch a local bus on the road outside the hotel) to Cornelia metro station you will be in the city centre in no time. Breakfast was good, your standard buffet breakfast, eggs, toast, cereal, pastries etc. We didn't eat dinner at the hotel because we were out and about so much.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain Rome getaway!”
Reviews.Author: CraigAndSam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in February 2012, and had a really good stay. The hotel itself is modern and clean and the room was spacious and comfortable. We were impressed by how nice the rooms were. We found the staff to all be pleasant. The breakfast was fine - it ran from 7 until 10am. The bar downstairs in the reception area is nice. We did not eat at the restaurant, preferring instead to find somewhere to eat in central Rome when we were out and about. The hotel is out of the centre of Rome which some people may not like, but we didn't find this to be a problem. You could get a bus right outside the hotel, but we opted to use the Metro. It was no more than a 10 minute walk to the Cornelia metro station. The Metro is easy to use in Rome as there are only 2 lines and so it was really easy to get to all the sites. You can get a 3 day pass for all public transport (Metro and buses) for 11 euros - bargain! Getting to the hotel when you arrive in Rome was interesting - we flew into Ciampino airport. You can get a bus for 6 euro return, and they run every half an hour. it takes you to Termini, which is the main station. We then bought the 3 day pass from the station and got on the metro. We then got a bit lost trying to find the hotel as it was dark, so I would recommend you flag down a taxi from the metro station if you arrive at night. All in all, a nice hotel and a great stay in Rome for a bargain price. We would stay here if we went to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was a lovely surprise”
Reviews.Author: celt20
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a converted monastery which has been open for about a year. The refurbishment has been carried out to a high standard, and as you would expect in Italy, is both elegant and stylish. The colours throughout the building are pale cream through to chocolate brown and all shades in between - delightful. Our room was spacious and the bathroom fabulous. The staff, led by the owner, were helpful and pleasant. The bottle of wine on arrival was a welcome gesture. A decent breakfast was provided and I can only describe the food in the restaurant as superb, particularly the fish dishes. It is a shame that the hotel did not sell tickets for the buses but they are prevented from doing so by the City of Rome authorities.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: possum33
Reviews.Content: There is no getting away from the fact that this hotel is a little bit out of the centre of Rome (about 1.5 km from St Peters Square), however the bus stop right outside takes you straight to St Peters (No 98 or 881) and from their its easy to get everywhere. The hotel itself was clean, modern, had a great choice for breakfast and had helpful and friendly staff. We ate in the restaurant on one night and the food was lovely and once again the staff were great. The rooms were very comfortable and the shower was fantastic. Would definitely stay here again if we visited Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Problem Free”
Reviews.Author: GregEssex
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night B&B stay at the ESH. The Hotel is modern, clean & very good value for money. The staff are friendly & helpful and i would recommend anyone visiting Rome stays here. The nearest Metro sta. is about a 5 min walk away and you can walk to the Vatican in about 20 mins. For value for money you'll be hard pushed to beat the ESH.

Reviews.Title: “esh hotel Rome”
Reviews.Author: tinlid
Reviews.Content: hotel 3/4 hr walk from Vatican. for those that want to be in the centre of Rome this is no good, although we used bus services which where very often a nd stopped right outside hotel. a four star hotel with a one star breakfast, one coffee machine for all the hotel , which was constantly broke. food and drinks constantly required topping up, which was done once asked.. Room clean, plenty of hot water. Was dreading going to this hotel after reading all reviews but wasnt as bad as expected. Cheap and cheerful. No real issues. p.s didint get wine on arrival but forgot all about it !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ignore bad reviews! Lovely and ask for hot water for tea at bar!”
Reviews.Author: Saginaw
Reviews.Content: We were a bit apprehensive when we read some of the reviews, but have learnt that we all have different expectations! Wow - we were pleasantly suprised! The room (at the front) was lovely and quiet (no noisy buses as mentioned previously) - the shower was one of the very best we've ever had! The lady Receptionist on our welcome, was lovely and always very pleasant and helpful - maybe its a case of 'you reap what you sow' - but the older guy who was on the desk in the morning could hardly raise a smile let alone give us some change for the bus! To help you get to the hotel - the numbers 881 or 98 do stop right outside the hotel and you pay a 1 euro coin into the machines on the buses - take coins as no change available. But you need to find all these buses and where they go from! Easiest way form the airport:- 1. get one of the buses into Rome (approx 6 euros) then you can buy the 3 day pass for about £35 from a tobacconists - BUT will you spend this much over 3 days as each bus gives you 75 mins use for each trip, even if you swap buses (includes one metro trip too if you want). The pass includes entrance to colesseum (about £12 each to get in) but we wouldn't have got value for money as we walked so much. 2. at bus station - get on the metro (pay euro for ticket) and go to Cornelia subway. 3. at Cornelia subway, get a bus number 889 (your ticket will still be valid so just get on) and take the bus to Via Torre Rossa road (the bus going towards rome not out of it) 4. Get off on the Via Torre Rossa road just outside the ESHotel on the Right hand side - it's hidden by a wall but is approx 500 yds after turning into the road. Good luck! If you try it by bus, you'll spend most of day searching for the right bus stops for the 881 or 98 from centre of Rome. The hotel is a litle out of Rome but the breakfast is more than adequate - there is a lot of choice and they keep bringing things out so they are trying to improve. the staff in the restaurant were always pleasant and we very much enjoyed our time in Rome. Just beware of the rip off restaurants though - go for the clearly marked set meals - they list steak as beef steak and it's lovely! Amazing city - we'll be back - especially when the euro becomes worth more!!!

Reviews.Title: “Only come here if you must.”
Reviews.Author: Monka_bp
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days here in December 2011. First they sent us up to a dirty room, then we got another. They do not have heating, only air condition which is very loud (if it works) also in the room and outside the building too, I could not sleep properly because of the noise. The breakfast is a joke, the problem that you paid for this very bad joke. But I got worse, because on one morning they could not present even this poor breakfast, they gave packaged food from like Tesco. The hotel is not close to the city at all, the road to the hotel is very busy and dangerous, there almost no space for walking. There is only one good thing about the venue, that the Villa Doria Pamphilj is close. If you happen to come to this neighbourhood don't miss the beautiful park.

Reviews.Title: “Nice city break”
Reviews.Author: Chris B
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ideal for visiting Rome on a budget. The staff were friendly and helpful, and although most of the staff spoke English, there were the odd ones who could not. The breakfast was more than adequate, and catered for the needs of most. The restaurant served excellent food, but the scope of the menu was limited, this may improve when the hotel becomes more established. This hotel is not quite complete yet, and due to the adverse extreme weather conditions, the air conditioning was struggling to cope with the low temperatures, which are the lowest recorded for 26 years. On the down side, there were no tea-making facilities in the rooms, the toaster and coffee machine on the breakfast buffet could not cope in a full restaurant, and often had long queues. The ambience of the restaurant could be improved with a little soft music in the background, when it is open.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not so good area, horrific Mini bar rip off!”
Reviews.Author: peterjmay
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the ESH after spending a 3 day trip in Rome. The hotel is rather nice and modern, very clean. The staff are not exactly the friendliest bunch of people in the world especially when you ask for a drink at the bar (which is hardly ever attended by staff). The hotel is situated in the student area of Rome alongside universities, it is NOT central but has a bus stop outside. Its a 20 minute walk to the nearest underground metro station. The real joke came when I took 2 cokes out of the mini bar after reading on the mini bar menu they were 3 euros each but when i came to checkout they slapped an 18 percent city tax on 2 cokes!! Making them the princely sum of 24 euros!! Outrageous!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel on the fringes of the city”
Reviews.Author: Dunedain
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Friday when Rome experienced its heaviest snowfall for 25 years! All means of transport were thrown into chaos and it took more than 3 hours to get to the hotel in those conditions. The hotel is located about 15 minutes walk from the Cornelia metro station. It is modern and one could not fault the cleanliness of the place. Our room was spacious and comfortable and the bathroom was spotless. The heating broke down on Saturday evening and was repaired the following day. As it got in the room, we used blankets provided to supplement the bed covers. There was a complimentary bottle of wine when we checked into our room. Staff were professional and helpful. The bespectacled young lady at front desk was charming and full of information. The breakfast served was adequate and of good quality with the usual cereals, fruits and cold and cooked meats. Overall, the pros outweigh the cons (no tea-making facilities - but then who would want to drink tea when good wine is inexpensive!; distance from the metro - walking is a good form of exercise!) and we have no hesitation in staying again as we would have to return to visit the sights that were closed due to the inclement weather.

Reviews.Title: “Good all round”
Reviews.Author: AWHi
Reviews.Content: Nice breakfast Clean and large bathroom On good bus route which is outside of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Travelbuddy2010
Reviews.Content: Loved this modern hotel in Rome- its new and everything works. The breakfast was very good and the hotel offered good value at the price paid. Only down was that the aircon in the rooms do not work correctly- after 3 nights I still dont know how to set the temp. The metro was a 15 minute walk. That said- there is a bus stop right in front of the hotel. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice out of town hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wolfie16
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in January. We got the metro to the hotel but it seemed an awful long way to walk to the hotel-at first. The pavements are very narrow on the approach as well. The breakfast is the same every day.it's roof top restaurant and they were working outside on scaffolding. I wasn't happy with the work men coming in to get breakfast whilst paying guests were eating also. Maybe it was a one-off? We didn't eat there in the evening as we were advised the food was "awful". Further down the road from the hotel , there's a nice restaurant to try.it was a bit dear but we hadn't really tried any "proper"restaurants in the city, just cafe's etc. Generally, we walked for miles and miles to see the sights. We knew that we could use our Metro card on the buses but Husband felt he wouldn't know where to get off, so we just used Metro. The traffic is frenetic with thousands of mopeds etc. The service in the cafe's was lovely. We had a lovely coffee at the cafe on the castle overlooking the Vatican city. There was no queuing to get into the Vatican either :) With only a 10kg luggage allowance I didn't do much shopping :( but I still managed to buy a handbag,pair of boots and shoes - all from one shop- Abitart. I would go again now I'd know what to expect .....and where to get off the buses!!

Reviews.Title: “good value rooms, good location if you can get round the public transport!”
Reviews.Author: Sally N
Reviews.Content: Our room was small, but modern and very clean. The bed was large and comfortable. The bathroom was well appointed with lots of clean fluffy towels. Check in staff were efficient and were able to explain the local bus service to us. The breakfast was served on the roof, in the tent that is described in previous reviews. On one of our days there was a torrential downpour and there were several leaks. It is chilly up there (taking into account that it is January) so dress approriately.. the breakfast itself is reasonable, given the price tag. The lift goes all the way to the roof, but is incorrectly labelled on the inside screen. (get off when the screen says level three when your room is on the fourth floor!) We were put off using the restaurant in the evening but thanks to another review on this website we visited some local very good and very very reasonable restaurants in the local area. (much cheaper and more authentic than the city centre where the tourist premium is high) We went to Ferro e Ghisa on the main road, Circ.ne Aurelia and Joseph's in the Via Accursio. Both of these are close to the Cornelia metro station and we simply called in on our way back from the city. There are many others to choose from. The hotel is a long way out of town, but the buses leave from directly outside. Buy the three day tourist pass for all froms of public transport in the city (11 Euros) and you won't have to worry about going into shops to buy tickets. We wouldn't have afforded Rome had we spent on a city centre hotel and meals in city restaurants. The ESH is the perfect solution.

Reviews.Title: “ESH Bellisimo!”
Reviews.Author: deborah c
Reviews.Content: I was shocked to read some of the more negative reviews given the marvellous stay we had from the 20th-23rd January 2012. The hotel was bright, airy and modern. We were warmly welcomed at reception, clean, spacious room. Shower was left sparkling by the cleaners every day.We booked through Broadway travel and what a bargain! my husband and I look for a high standard and we were not disappointed. Yes there were building works going on that affected breakfast. It was machine coffee and juice but the manager assured me that by the time our teenage daughter and friend arrive for their first "grown-up" holiday alone it will all be completed. It is a short 20 minute bus ride into the heart of Rome with the bus stop literally on the doorstep, 1 euro a journey or buy a 3 day pass for 11 euros.On our last day my husband left his medication in the rooms' mini bar and when staff went to look for it it had been removed ready for next guests. The manager must have got them to search the bins or something because they found it just as our airport transfer arrived. In fact nothing was too much trouble for the staff and the manager himself was charming. (He has arranged for dinner "on the house" when our daughter arrives. Hows that for service!) You can nitpick over kettles and plugpoints but I can honestly thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, disappointed with the location”
Reviews.Author: laur3njayn3
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel with broadway travel in November for a 4 night stay - 25th January 2012. Upon arrival to the hotel (after finding it) it was disappointing to find the location of the hotel was so out of town. When booking the travel agent told us it was 10 minutes from the Vatican, making us believe by foot but this was actually by bus. Closest metro was a 10 minute brisk walk down the narrowest of pavements. We found the hotel was too far out of town to come home to freshen up in the afternoon to go out at night so we were usually out from 10am until 9/10pm it is a long day and we were shattered! Rooms were excellent, very modern and clean. Room was cleaned everyday. Breakfast was a bonus - even though it was a bit boring by the 3rd day. It was the same selection most days. The male waiter (not sure of his name) was very helpful. We had free wifi with our booking which is usually 10euro for 5 days. Upon checkout we were slightly disappointed with being stung with a local tax bill. 3e per person per night, 24euro bill. Surely this would have been better upon checkin not checkout when ur annoyed to be going home :(

Reviews.Title: “Clean modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: smiffyj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ESH for 3 nights and found the hotel clean, modern and the staff friendly. The breakfast was fine although continental it did include bacon. The rooms where clean and very nice and modern. There was no tea or coffee facilities and only one English tv station if your wanting to watch tv. The bus stop was right outside the hotel and took around 10 minutes to reach the Vatican. You do need to go to a shop to buy bus tickets. There was a shop about 5 minutes walk away. Make sure you validate your ticket on the machine on the bus. We did not have this explained to us and a bus conductor tried to get 100 euros from us as a fine and "claimed" to be calling the Police. Lucky I seen through his obvious con and stood my ground before he give up and validated the ticket manually and let us go. Anyway Rome is beautiful abeit expensive in the tourist areas. The hotel is within easy reach of the sites and upon check in we were provided with a map and an explanation of the best way to town from the helpful friendly staff behind the check in desk. Overall I would recommend this hotel as it is quiet and away from the busier areas and still within easy reach of everything.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: kenny2394
Reviews.Content: Hello all who stayed 16 Jan- 20 th, just been reading some of your reveiws, must say we (Kenny& Sue) enjoyed our stay, although there were issues with the restraurant, other wise we found the hotel, clean, comfortable, and friendly. The breakfast we found was good once they sorted the hot drinks machines, and of course dinner was always eventful, some great characters there with us . The staff were exellent, although out of the city it was easy to find your way around, Would we stay there again ,yes we would, I brought the attention of the co owner of the problems in the restraurant, and there was a vast improvement thereafter, Overall exellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent find!”
Reviews.Author: Jenny A
Reviews.Content: We were highly delighted with all aspects of this hotel, the staff, the restaurant, the room, although I could have used more electrical sockets for chargers etc, were first class, and we felt that the negative comments on TA were totally unjustified. I would recommend the ESH to anyone visiting Rome, the fact that it is away from the hubbub of the centre is a bonus as far as we were concerned, travel by bus to the tourist areas was easy and inexpensive. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: margaret b
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was on a special offer so wasn't, expecting much. We were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the hotel and room. Sparsely furnished in a modern style, clean and fresh. Breakfast was plentiful and from 7to 11 so a lie in was good after a night in the city. Buses into the city were frequent and cheap so being a bit out of town was not a problem. Thoroughly recommended

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: PeterManchesterUK
Reviews.Content: Some other reviews focus on minor quibbles about the restaurant or location, we booked with eyes wide open & so we weren't disappointed. Yes the hotel IS some way out of town - but quieter then is a real bonus at night! Once you get acquainted with the bus service options - it is really easy & convenient. The restaurant is a work in progress & should be completed this week, but excellent breakfast options are available in a stylish roof-top setting. Roofs are well-appointed & spotlessly clean, staff are generally happy & helpful so on balance we think ESH is a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room and staff”
Reviews.Author: jocheerio
Reviews.Content: Jan 25th 2012 Just returned from 3 night stay at ESH, can't fault the hotel or staff. Breakfast was adequate and a bonus considering price. Did not eat dinner at hotel so cannot comment. We chose to eat dinner out and took trip advisor recommendation of Alturo restaurant which we found disappointing and overpriced. The hotel staff recommended Ferro e ghiza nearby which was very good and contemporary in style. We also ate at nearby Josephs which was more traditional and excellent value (half price of Alturo). Hotel has great location with bus stop right outside and Metro stop 10 minute brisk walk. Metro easily navigated with only 2 lines to choose from. We bought a 3 day Roma pass for 30 euros which enabled us to use Metro/bus/2 museum passes (incl the colesseum but not the Vatican). The pass enabled us priority entrance at the colesseum. The city is much quieter in Jan than the Summer but there was still quite a queue which was worth 30 euros in itself. Summer is beautiful in Rome but totally overcrowded, in January it is much easier and the weather was very pleasant. In short a wonderful city and despite not throwing a coin in the Trevi Fountain we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Smart contemporary hotel but not convenient for walking to main attractions.”
Reviews.Author: Milsie007
Reviews.Content: First impression of hotel was immaculate modern and very contemporary with well appointed spacious rooms/bathrooms. It is advisable to request room to rear of building due to coaches parking at front and leaving early, from 6am, having parked with their engines running for upto an hour!!! We had this all three mornings we stayed! Breakfast ok but could be varied a little more. During our trip they were hosting a conference which included loud entertainment one evening. Unfortunately this took place in the roof restaurant finishing around midnight and due to the quiet location, was very audible. The following morning's breakfast staff were limited to just two people serving and this caused chaos in the restaurant meaning that tables were not cleared - no cups, glasses etc available until you asked for them. Food was not being replenished as required. There is obviously a problem when catering for residents and conference delegates at the same time. Despite its faults the staff were very friendly and helpful. Overal I would recommend this hotel as they just need to resolve a few minor issues.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Wayfarer8
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel we were pleasantly suprised. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The city centre was easily accessible by either bus or metro. (Avoid the No. 64 as our friend was targetted by a pick pocket but thankfully the perpetrator was thwarted!). The buses are filled to capacity with passengers (in the UK this would be a H & S issue but hey ho - when in Rome etc. etc.!!). Another downside was the Bar Moretto which is very close to the Vatican - we were charged 18 euro for a large beer! In all fairness this was a little more than a litre so the moral here is when asking for a large beer ask to see the drinks price list first! Overall we had a fantastic time in Rome. The staff at the ESH couldn't have done more - they even provided us with tea making facilities when we said we couldn't function without our early morning tea (typical Brits!). So this gesture alone earns them at least four stars. The American breakfast was adequate and for the price paid we felt this was a bonus as in other hotels for a similar price we have been served a basic continental breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel but dire restaurant”
Reviews.Author: julie_eperry
Reviews.Content: Trip booked through Broadway Travel as a birthday treat for me. On eventual arrival at ESF after a train journey and 2 bus changes (will definitely book transfers from airport to hotel next time), we were delighted with the welcome from staff and the quality of the room. Only downside was the restaurant experience on the first night which we decided to use as were tired after arriving at 5.30 pm and although it was my birthday decided to try the restaurant on the 5th floor. Where shall I start...? we shared a mixed platter of cold meats and cheese - very average - but the problems began with the main courses when my husband ordered chicken and was told there was none so was offered a pork escalope instead. My fillet steak arrived 20 minutes after my husband's meal which arrived 10 mins after the cold side dishes. The steak was poor quality and well done, not medium rare as requested. I sent the steak back and was offered an alternative which when it arrived turned out to be horse meat. By now I was cross and hungry and we asked to see the manager who said we would not be charged for the meal. By now, other British couples were sharing their dining experiences with us and all agreed that the restaurant badly let down the hotel. We endured breakfasts for the 4 days there but ate out at other restaurants in the evenings. Overall, good bus links into the city and would recommend to others but they need to get a new chef.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent review i had to copy and paste”
Reviews.Author: WrexhamSteve1945
Reviews.Content: Because of the excellent price paid for a weekend in Rome, we were expecting Travel Lodge or lower standard from this hotel. we were was pleasantly surprised. It was clean, modern, the rooms were spacious, comfortable and the bathroom was lovely. The service was excellent from the staff. The breakfast was adequate, you get what you pay for, again this was more than I expected. We had decided before arriving we would be walking everywhere in Rome, to take in the atmosphere and burn off all that ice cream! We did walk from the hotel into town. It takes about 30 minutes to the Vatican and about another 30 to the Roman Forum. We did this 3 days in a row and by the end I have to admit our feet were suffering and the absence of a bath was noted. The only issue with being out of town is being unable to pop back late afternoon, freshen up and go out to enjoy the evening, as you could do if you were in the center. A suggestion for the hotel would perhaps be a shuttle service at set times for people who want to do this. Others that used the buses said they were no problem and relatively cheap.I would recommend this hotel and would stay again.... Stayed January 2012, travelled as a couple

Reviews.Title: “4 star room, 2 star breakfast”
Reviews.Author: GypsyMajor
Reviews.Content: Our room was excellent, very clean, spacious and the bed large and comfortable, in fact a real pleasure to come back to after a day in Rome. Fixtures and fittings were all high quality although sometimes trying a little too hard to be stylish, e.g. the dark brown opaque shades on the bedside lamps made it more difficult to read with the lamps on - we unscrewed them! As others have commented, the room thermostat didn't appear to have any actual connection to the air-conditioning but the temperature was OK most of the time and you could open the window to let some cool air in (in January anyway). The hotel seems to have been converted from something else, probably theological student accommodation. Whatever happened, they obviously realised at the last minute they'd forgotten to add a restaurant, so they built a framed tent like affair on the roof with tarpaulin walls and 2 space heaters, accessed only by one small lift, no stairs, must be a nightmare if the hotel is full. A good breakfast would have made up for it but they forgot that part as well! Probably the worst breakfast I've been served (sorry, toasted it myself and boiled the egg myself and operated the lukewarm coffee vending machine myself) in a hotel that I can remember. Seems a bit churlish to complain as we were on a very good deal (as were all the other Brits we spoke to) but it is supposed to be 4 star... It's an easy busride from the centre, metro 10 minutes walk (or bus to it) so being out in the suburbs is not a problem at all. Would we go again? - Yes but not at full price. ps Just looked at the hotel's website. There are pictures of a smart looking dining room there but it's definitely not the one we were in!

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic- Yet Costly Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jocelynne H
Reviews.Content: Upon a recent trip to Italy we spent 5 nights at the Esh Hotel, Rome. Upon waking up the first day, we discovered there was NO hot water. We all had cold showers, reported the incident and were told the technician would be out. 12h00 that same day, there was still NO hot water. The second day presented the same scenario. NO hot water. We were afforded the contents of the bar fridge as a peace offering. Are bar fridges not supposed to be re-stocked? Apparently not. We were apparently only given what was in the fridge at the time. This worsened the experience. On the third day 2 out of the 3 rooms we stayed in were NOT made up by housekeeping. What a disgrace to a so-called "Executive Style Hotel." We were also not given slippers, gowns or anymore than 5 coat hangers. I wouldn't advise anyone to stay here. At all. What a disappointment. Costly disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid”
Reviews.Author: johnnywhitts
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel through Broadway Travel for a suprise birthday present for my husband. Just got back and loved the city of Rome. The hotel is very stylish and the staff are all very friendly and cant do enough for you . The room was small and basic but very clean and quiet. Breakfast is on the top floor and is what you would expect a continental breakfast to be. The location was the only problem as you are a long way from anything and although their is a bus route at the end of the drive you cannot actually walk to a restaurant or bar easily in the evening. I would go back to this Hotel and recommend it as it is in a quiet suburb away from the madness that is Rome

Reviews.Title: “More than expected”
Reviews.Author: geejay2011
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel during the Christmas holiday weekend. On the outside, the hotel wasn't so impressive to me. However, the inside was well kept and had a bit of a modern flair. I asked for our room to be in a quiet section of the hotel and on the highest floor. Unlike some European hotels in which the staff always make excuses as to the fact that they cannot offer another room... the staff at this hotel were very accommodating. Although we were too early to check-in, a staff member apologized for the room not being ready and gave us a complimentary espresso and latte macchiato. Anything I asked for they were able to deliver without an attitude. I really felt as though they wanted to make my stay a great one...as it should be. Yes, the hotel is away from the city but the bus was right outside the building and easy to access. It took us only 10 minutes to get to the Vatican and about 20 minutes to get to the Colosseum. I am not a fan of bus services but I must say that this was very convenient and affordable. The staff was very helpful in giving directions so we never had a problem. My hotel room was modern, clean and reasonably spacious. I was very happy and loved the bathroom. The only negative thing I have to say is that the breakfast was not good at all. Every morning the hotel had dry eggs, really salty bacon, small tasteless sausages, some yoghurt, canned fruits...it did not fit with the great service and warm decor. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome. The staff are extremely friendly, helpful and concerned about your comfort. You will love it!

Reviews.Title: “3 night stay in December”
Reviews.Author: wgpettigrew
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, pleasant and polite staff, very clean and modern, tasteful and clean rooms. There are bus stops just outside the gates which take you in to the centre or up to the nearest metro. We had a great time in Rome and would go back again. I was a bit worried by some of the negative remarks made before our trip, but then, it takes all sorts :) I would also return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: HYDE55
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here as part of a package deal for four days flying with Ryanair.For what we paid the hotel was wonderful value for money. Yes if you made your own way there and you were new to the city then you probably dont get the best impression of where it is situated . Having said that using the metro and public buses you get a better insight into the real Rome and get to talk to real people not just other tourists. There are plenty of taxis if you so choose. The room was lovely and airy , plenty of space. Brilliant shower in the very modern bathroom ( I love a bath of which there wasnt one but the shower more than made up for that ) The bed was huge and very comfortable and far exceeded what we had expected reading other reviews .We ate here on the first evening and in honesty although the food was enjoyable it was a little on the expensive side and be aware that the main courses come with no side dishes , they are extra. A hotel has to make its money somewhere and we appreciate that so not complaining, but we did decide to eat elsewhere the other nights. Breakfast was pleasant enough. The dining room was clean, nice china, a help yourself to whatever you want affair. There was adequate choice and you have to remember that if you are looking for a full English then you should perhaps stay in England. This was Italy and in fairness they were catering for all nationalities and again for the price we paid I would have no complaints. Tea and coffee etc were out of a vending machine as someone mentioned in another review but thats often the case even in some quality establishments. Overall breakfast served its purpose. On the final morning there was a large coach party in and we were basically asked to sit outside the dining room in the entrance hall. It was fine as we were flying back that morning and werent looking for a leisurely breakfast but had we paid full price , would we have been happy with that ? . Possibly not. In conclusion the hotel was over and above what we expected for the deal we had paid for and we have no complaints . Bear in mind also that over and above the normal tips you may choose to leave there is a compulsary 3 euro per night tax.

Reviews.Title: “A new place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Claudiagiannini
Reviews.Content: If you don't want to stay in an old hotel with old bathrooms, you should visit the ESH Rome, for a good price you will have a very goog bedroom with an excellent bathroom, the hall area has a modern decor with a nice bar, the hallwaysare quite hot some days. The hotel is not in the certer, it is near the vaticano in a perfect distance away from the tourists mess and not to far from the places you want to see, bus and taxis avaiable anytime. I duly recomend.

Reviews.Title: “Freezing”
Reviews.Author: Ionela M
Reviews.Content: Hello. We had a two nights with breakfast included “experience” at ESH, at the end of November. Thumbs up for the breakfast. It was a buffet with almost everything: from cereals to omlette, and from natural juice to coffee. The room was great but... here comes the very big minus: it was extremely cold. The worming system was activated when entering the room, by card, so the rooms started worming when you entered. Or... being the end of November...this was not enough to bring the room temperature near to comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels in Rome”
Reviews.Author: john t
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in many hotels in Rome this one shone out like a star! Rooms spacious and quiet. Food excellent and very reasonable. Staff very friendly. Very first comments on any site in my life, but felt this establishment deserves it.

Reviews.Title: “Coach Party Hotel”
Reviews.Author: highdays_holidays
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine for an overnight stop with a tour but do not book this if you are making your own plans. My husband and I booked a superior room and I am so glad we did given that we were there for 7 nights as the standard rooms are much smaller. If you are on the ground floor half of your one window will be below ground, you will be directly in line with the engine of the coach parked outside and it will feel like a cell! Our room in general was fine, fixtures and fittings are not good quality, small stain on the bedspread but bed generally clean and comfortable, housekeeping leaves a little to be desired but generally ok. This hotel is pretty new but rooms are already looking a little shabby in places, grouting in bathrooms is one example and I don’t believe the rooms will stand up to the test of time. No kettle in room, had to ask for one, safe stopped working on day 2 – not fixed and no one updated us. No English TV channels, sockets not working and there is no individual temperature control in rooms (although there is a misleading thermostat which looks like you should be able to on the wall). There is a fridge in the room with limited drinks availability. I think there was room service, no idea what they served as no information in the room. No information on how to use the phone either. This hotel is good for coach parties as it has a large car park. One evening there were two coaches parked out the front and two at the back. This must be one of the only hotels in Rome where this is possible. The problem is that this makes an early breakfast impossible unless you want to fight your way through crowds. They regularly ran out of cups, bowls and food. Coffee and hot water were from a vending machine, horrible. Food quality was generally poor. Staff were rushed (although heavens knows why because it was all buffet) and generally miserable, no effort at a ‘good morning’ in any language just ‘room number’. We waited for the coach parties to leave, and gave them 15 minutes to re-stock. This explains the differences in reviews regarding breakfast. If you go early it is awful, if you go later while the quality of the food does not improve, it is quieter and you may have some crockery. We never bothered trying the restaurant in the evening. Coach parties leaving early mean you may get your own built in wake up call if you are a light sleeper but generally we were ok on the 4th floor, room 416 (they seem to put guests who were staying a bit longer on the upper floors). However if your room faces the front of the hotel the the coaches leave their engines running for some time before boarding. I have seen other reviews which refer to a courtyard and the grounds of the hotel. These no longer exist and it looks like this area has been sold off as there is a temporary fence structure meaning there are only a few tables to sit out at round the back of the hotel which is like sitting in a car park. This hotel is too far out of the city and we had to travel in and out by bus and Sunday evening the buses were busy and infrequent. Rome is a beautiful city and this made our stay, the hotel did not and we used it purely as a base from which to explore. For this it suited our purpose although if we had been closer to the city we may have gone back to our hotel for a couple of hours in the afternoon and then gone out in the evening. The distance of this hotel to the city does not make this possible. We booked this as part of a package but I don’t think this hotel is cheap either so look around. What you may be able to tolerate on a one night stop over will annoy you after two or three. Also check your bill, we were charged for room service we did not receive and an additional internet charge. It is not worth its 4 star rating, food is poor, reception staff were generally helpful but the rest are disinterested and treat you like you’re a nuisance, shop around.

Reviews.Title: “Chaotic but nice”
Reviews.Author: hlib
Reviews.Content: While we worried about hotel location, it proved good. Bus connection (practically) from hotel door to city centre is good and works till midnight. However, it is still not in foot proximity to city centre, and if you are a tourist, you should understand that you will leave hotel in the morning and return in the evening with midday/early evening return being impractical. Anyway it is much better than alternatives near Termini with the same price tag - it is located on quiet hill near other conference hotels and Catholic Church training facilities. Hotel itself is new and clean. Design is modern and nice but very user-unfriendly (small wash-stand with lack of space for personal items, lack of hooks in bathroom, inconvenient wall outlets and switches, etc.). AC system is living its own life, and I have not found in 6 days how to manage it (while room temperature is more or less OK). Staff is friendly but on check-out porter miscalculated tourist tax for 18 EUR (not in our benefit), and I needed 10 minutes to prove it to him. He did not say "sorry" after admitting mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: irishnewlyweds09
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in the ESH hotel and cannot fault it apart from the service of the staff. You would think it was a chore for them to smile! Plus on arrival after waiting over 20minutes while the desk clerk chatted away to someone in Italian, he informed us that our room was not ready and to come back in 40mins. When he finally called us to give us our room key, he never got anyone to help us with our bags, he never told us where the lift was to our room, never told us what level floor we were on, never told us the time for breakfast or where it was and never told us our check out time. These requests come as standard. He wasn't rude, but in no way helpful. On check out we were served by a woman who was alot nicer in comparison. The rooms were spotless and had nice contemporary decor. We never ate in the restuarant apart from breakfast, which was lovely and had everything from scrambled eggs, bacon to freshly baked croissants and fresh fruit. The bar and restuarant are brightly lit, with no music, which doesn't really create a nice atmosphere, but these are minor complaints. The location was one of our biggest concerns given the reviews we read. But the bus (which is quite frequent) is literally outside the hotel or it is a 10minute walk to two metro stations. It takes about 10minutes to get into the city centre by public transport (just avoid rush hour, we found out the hard way! :-) Overall i would most likely stay here again. The only improvement would be that some of the staff should take some lessons in customer service and be alittle friendlier :)

Reviews.Title: “Not good at all”
Reviews.Author: arbee8
Reviews.Content: Too far out town and I would rate hotel as a 2 not 4 star,lots of things the hotel does not have wouldn't recommend at all,

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a bit out of the city”
Reviews.Author: libtek
Reviews.Content: This hotel was opened In October 2010 so is very new and up to date. As other reviewers have noted, it is situated outside the City of Rome which does mean that you get a good nights sleep as it's quite quiet, but I didn't realise quite how far out it was (the taxi driver got lost taking us there from the airport). However it was in a nice area and felt quite safe even at night. and buses do go into parts of the City from the bus stop conveniently located outside the hotel. If you get a 3 day or weekly tourist ticket it's very cheap to get around. Checkin was smooth and efficient. The man behind the reception desk was very helpful and provided a map and details on how to get to the Vatican and other sites by public transport.. Our room was quite spacious and very clean. The bathroom was quite big nd well equipped. Although the hotel offered WiFi this wasn't working during our 4 day stay, although as it was a problem with the phone line it wasn't really the hotels fault.. The A/C in the room didn't seem to work which as it was hot was a bit of a problem. When we queried this at the desk on our way out one morning we were told to speak to the afternoon receptionist about switching it on. We didn't get back till about 7.30 that night so didn't bother but opened a window instead. The complimentary breakfast buffet was very good and on the whole we enjoyed our stay. With the exception of the man we saw on our first day I didn't feel that the staff were especially helpful and this and the distance the hotel is from Rome itself stopped it being rated Excellent. However I would have no hesitation recommending this hotel. It's modern, clean and quiet and now I know how to get into the city from the ESH Hotel I would stay there again if I returned to Rome..

Reviews.Title: “Simply the friendliest”
Reviews.Author: johnzio
Reviews.Content: Our group had a really great time at ESH!!!! The rooms were very clean and well-equiped full of comforts. The garden, the hall and the restaurant were also clean and tidy. Moreover there was always someone (not only at the reception, but also at the hall and at the garden) willing to help you and trying always to give the best of his/her sevices. Furthermore, everyone of the stuff was really welcome and friendly. Last but not least, i totally recommend this hotel for everyone wanting to visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel bringing out the true flavour of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: paolo090
Reviews.Content: First time in this modern hotel in peaceful setting near the Vatican. Excellent surroundings for an early morning run in the near by park. Staff very professional and welcoming. As a group of 3 friends travelling together we felt at home from the first moment. Staff and managementvery helpful with advice and recommendations. Rooms were spotless and very comfortable! Would highly recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Stylish, comfortable and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: EdKennedy_11
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay here. The facilities were excellent, and the staff were friendly and accommodating. The manager that we dealt with was fluent in English and gave us some useful local information. The hotel is newly opened, and all the facilities are contemporary and stylish. The hotel is a short bus ride from the main Rome attractions(bus stop is outside the gate), which means less traffic noise and a good nights' sleep!

HotelInfo.Name: Esh Executive Style Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Di Torre Rossa 80, 00165 Rome, Italy
